snippet: Immigration authorities who have tried for years to deport Gen. Carlos Eugenio Vides Casanova now say he has to remain in the United States for at least another week.
abstract: Immigration authorities who succeeded after 16-year litigation in having El Salvadoran Gen Eugenio Vides Casanova deported for human rights abuses committed by his troops in 1980s now say he must remain in United State for another week, citing legal and diplomatic complications.
lead_paragraph: Immigration authorities who have tried for years to deport Gen. Carlos Eugenio Vides Casanova now say he has to remain in the United States for at least another week.

headline.main: U.S. Delays Deportation of Salvadoran Ex-Official Accused in ’80s Killings
headline.print_headline: U.S. Delays Deportation of Salvadoran Ex-Official
